costLimit.description: Cost limit in configured currency (default EUR) or CO2 limit in g/kWh
costLimit.name: cost

result.description: Battery mode. 0: unknown, 1: normal, 2: hold, 3: charge

meterStart.description: Meter reading at start of charging session

meterStop.description: Meter reading at end of charging session

State.description: The actual state structure is not documented yet. Most values should be self-explanatory. Note: While the overall structure is quite stable, details may change between releases.

items.description: 0: Sunday, 1: Monday, 2: Tuesday, 3: Wednesday, 4: Thursday, 5: Friday, 6: Saturday

post.description: Administrator login. Returns authorization cookie required for all protected endpoints.

schema.example: auth=ey...qY; Path=/; Expires=Fri, 04 Apr 2025 14:35:37 GMT; HttpOnly; SameSite=Strict

post.description: Logout and delete authorization cookie

get.description: Whether the current user is logged in.

post.description: Prevent home battery discharge during vehicle fast charging.
Charge home battery from grid when price or emissions are below the threshold. Uses price if a dynamic tariff exists. Uses emissions if a CO₂-tariff is configured. Ignored otherwise.

delete.description: Default evcc control behavior is restored

post.description: Directly controls the mode of all controllable batteries. evcc behavior like 'price limit' or 'prevent discharge while fast charging' is overruled. External mode resets after 60s. The external system has to call this endpoint regularly.
Set battery buffer SoC.
Set battery buffer start SoC.

get.description: Returns 200 if the evcc loop runs as expected.

post.description: Enable or disable battery boost.
Delay before charging stops in solar mode.
Specifies the grid draw power to stop charging in solar mode.
Delay before charging starts in solar mode.
Specifies the available surplus power to start charging in solar mode.
Updates the energy limit of the loadpoint. Only available for guest vehicles and vehicles with unknown SoC. Limit is removed on vehicle disconnect.
Updates the SoC limit of the loadpoint. Requires a connected vehicle with known SoC. Limit is maintained across charging sessions.
Updates the maximum current of the loadpoint.
Updates the minimum current of the loadpoint.
Changes the charging behavior of the loadpoint.

Updates the allowed phases of the loadpoint. Selects the desired phase mode for chargers with automatic phase switching. For manual phase switching chargers (via cable or Lasttrennschalter) this value tells evcc the actual phases.

400.description: Invalid phases-value. You have most likely entered the value 0 for a wallbox that cannot switch phases automatically.

get.description: Returns the current charging plan for this loadpoint.

delete.description: Delete charging plan. Only available when a vehicle without SoC is connected.

post.description: Create charging plan with fixed time and energy target. Only available when a vehicle without SoC is connected.

get.description: Simulate repeating charging plan and return the result. Does not alter the actual charging plan.
Simulate charging plan based on energy goal. Does not alter the actual charging plan.
Simulate charging plan based on SoC goal. Does not alter the actual charging plan.

post.description: Set loadpoint priority.

delete.description: Delete cost or emission limit for fast-charging with grid energy.

post.description: Set cost or emission limit for fast-charging with grid energy.

delete.description: Delete limit for feed-in priority optimization.

post.description: Set limit for feed-in priority optimization.

delete.description: Remove vehicle from loadpoint. Connected vehicle is treated as guest vehicle.

patch.description: Starts the automatic vehicle detection process.

post.description: Assigns vehicle to loadpoint.
Set battery priority SoC.
Set grid connection operating point.

get.description: Returns a list of charging sessions.

post.description: Enable or disable telemetry. Note: Telemetry requires sponsorship.

delete.description: Convenience method to remove limit for all loadpoints at once. Value is applied to each individual loadpoint.
delete.summary: Remove smart charging cost limit for all loadpoints.

post.description: Convenience method to set smart charging cost limit for all loadpoints at once. Value is applied to each individual loadpoint.
post.summary: Set smart charging cost limit for all loadpoints

delete.description: Convenience method to remove limit for all loadpoints at once. Value is applied to each individual loadpoint.
delete.summary: Remove smart feed-in priority limit for all loadpoints.

post.description: Convenience method to set smart feed-in priority limit for all loadpoints at once. Value is applied to each individual loadpoint.
post.summary: Set smart feed-in priority limit for all loadpoints

get.description: Returns the complete state of the system. This structure is used by the UI. It can be filtered by JQ to only return a subset of the data.

parameters.description: Number of log lines to return
parameters.name: count

get.description: Returns a list of all log areas (e.g. `lp-1`, `site`, `db`).

post.description: Shut down instance. There is no reboot command. We expect the underlying system (docker, systemd, etc.) to restart the evcc instance once it's terminated.

get.description: Returns the prices or emission values for the upcoming hours

post.description: Charging will stop when this SoC is reached.
Vehicle will be fast-charged until this SoC is reached.
Updates the repeating charging plan.
Create charging plan with fixed time and SoC target.
